summary: Backend testing completed for TEA Operational Limitations Detection feature. All 18 tests passed. API endpoints work correctly, MongoDB unique index exists, and pattern detection is functional.

minor.issue: Pydantic deprecation warning: class-based config in OperationalLimitation model should use ConfigDict instead

critical_code_review_comments: Code is well-structured with proper error handling and logging
LimitationDetectorService correctly extracts raw text - never transforms to status or calculates compliance
MongoDB unique index 'aircraft_report_limitation_unique' prevents duplicate limitations per report
Integration in OCR apply endpoint (line ~1497) is non-blocking - errors logged but don't fail the apply operation
Pattern detection covers ELT (25 NM, ELT EXPIRED), AVIONICS (CONTROL ZONE, TRANSPONDER), and GENERAL (ON CONDITION, OVERDUE) categories
seed_data_creation: Test limitations inserted directly into MongoDB for API tests, cleaned up after tests
context_for_next_testing_agent: Operational Limitations API is fully functional. Tests cover: empty list response, limitations with correct structure (id, limitation_text, detected_keywords, category, confidence, report_id, report_date), category filtering, summary endpoint, delete endpoint, 404 for invalid aircraft, 401 for unauthenticated requests, pattern detection for ELT/AVIONICS/GENERAL categories, and MongoDB unique index verification. Test user: test@aerologix.com / testpassword123
